title: How kind-hearted strangers fulfilled dying wish of parents who passed away after heartbreaking picture
text:
Julie and Mike Bennet died within days of each other Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Generous strangers have fulfilled the dying wish of a couple who bravely faced death together after an unthinkable double terminal cancer diagnosis. 
More than £125,000 has been raised in just five days in an online campaign to support the children of Mike and Julie Bennet, who died within days of each other. 
The terminally ill parents were pictured reaching out for one another as they said their final goodbye in a heartbreaking photo that went viral on the internet. 
They wanted nothing more than to ensure that their children - Luke, 21, Hannah, 18, and Oliver, 13 - would be able to remain in the family home and continue their education following their deaths. The Bennet family in happier times 
Mike, 57, succumbed to a brain tumour on February 6, surrounded by Julie and their children. Read More Ed Sheeran to headline Teenage Cancer Trust concert at London's Royal Albert Hall next month 
Just five days later, Julie, 50, peacefully died on Saturday night, the Liverpool Echo reports. 
The photo was shared by their children and was taken just days before the much loved dad-of-three died. It was published as Julie lay dying in a Merseyside hospice herself. 
They wanted the world to know how much they loved each other - and were together until the very end. 
Family friend, Heather Heaton Gallagher, a spokesperson for the children, said: “Words cannot express our desperate sadness for such a beautiful family. 
“The Bennets are known to all for their generosity, their love for life, and their down to earth approach. An online campaign was launched to support the children 
"Julie has kept the children in a normal routine whilst dealing with Mike’s illness over the past few years. Read More Parents of dying baby girl with rare disease in desperate rush to raise £500k for life-saving treatment 
“When Julie became ill, she made it her purpose to create as many memories as a family for the children to hold onto.” 
She added: “Facing a double terminal cancer diagnosis is beyond belief and, as a community, we are working hard to support the family so that they can stay together and ensure that they can continue their education as planned.” 
Mike had been fighting a battle with cancer since 2013 and had been nursed at home by Julie and the children. 
He was a self-employed cabinet maker who had served his apprenticeship with Baldock’s Furniture Makers in Liverpool. A photo from the website appealing to help Luke, Hannah and Oliver (Photo: justgiving.com) 
Julie, a primary school teacher at Somerville School, Wallasey, was diagnosed with cancer in May last year. 
She had liver and kidney cancer which spread to other parts of her body. 
In the heartbreaking image shared by the children, Julie clings to her dying husband Mike's hand, as she says goodbye to him. 
Heather said: “The kids are so overwhelmed by the love and support that has been demonstrated, and they want to share their heartfelt thanks to everyone who has made this possible. Read More Little boy left paralysed within HOURS after waking up with aching legs 
“It has meant that their lovely mum could go peacefully to join their dad Mike, who passed earlier this week. 
“Julie was such an incredible woman. When faced with a devastating diagnosis, she never gave up, she was always focused on taking care of other people, I recall a rare moment of sadness she shared with me, saying: ‘My children don’t deserve this’ and that was Julie, no matter how upset she was personally her focus was on her kids.” 
Anyone who wants to support the family with raffle prizes for fundraiser events or to help in the campaign please contact Sue Wright on 07471030500 and go to JustGiving . Like us on Facebook
